fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30625].
  {panel}

A page has been deleted accidentally as part of a space delete where the page was not shown due to different permissions.
Is it possible to recover the page using the link for it? This is shown below

https://prepaysolutions.atlassian.net/wiki/x/OoYgAQ

The page is likely called 'EBS Steering meeting notes'

Thanks

Matt
fields.summary: Recovery of a Deleted page using a link
'preview' web-resource context should include 'atl.general' resources

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30615].
  {panel}

When following the [Defining 'Priority' Field Values|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Defining+'Priority'+Field+Values] documentation to update an icon to an image held externally (accessible URL), JIRA Issues macro fails to downsize the image in Confluence pages:
!icon.png!

In JIRA, the new icon is resized appropriately.
h4. Steps to reproduce:
# In JIRA, edit the icon of a 'Priority' - https://<baseURL>/secure/admin/ViewPriorities.jspa
# Place an accessible URL to it - e.g. http://www.nor1.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/04/logoAtlassianPNG.gif
# Save changes
# In Confluence, add a JIRA Issues macro that will display an issue with that priority
fields.summary: JIRA Issues macro fails to downsize external icon image
Set up step error

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30608].
  {panel}

Every Atlassian application has different scripts formats and workflow. We should have a common format guidelines to make them consistent between applications.

This will bring us the following wins:
* Sysadmins of Atlassian products will be able to configure any product in the same way, reducing the learning curve.
* Some pages in the documentation (and also the KB space) would be valid for all products, making them easier to maintain.

I personally like the way the files are formatted in JIRA (and Bamboo) but we should agree in a common format.
fields.summary: Get consistent start, stop, configuration and installation scripts across Atlassian products

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30603].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
Open Confluence via safari from an ipad
Open a page in confluence
Click view in desktop mode
Edit page
Type some text
Use magnifier to move cursor to another location
Unable to type any new text or move cursor again
fields.summary: Editor stops working in Safari on iPad when moving cursor to new location
Uploading multiple files at the same time
Add possibility to specify macro body default value
Support for Oracle 12c
Include Templates in site exports

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30589].
  {panel}

When you Share a page with a Group, the UI indicates that the share was successful, a green (/) Sent icon is shown, but the emails are not actually sent.

On the logs you can see the following stack trace:

{noformat}
2013-08-28 13:11:04.880009500 2013-08-28 13:11:04,878 ERROR [Long running task: Share Page (with groups) Task] [confluence.util.longrunning.ConfluenceAbstractLongRunningTask] run Long running task "Share Page (with groups) Task" failed to run.
2013-08-28 13:11:04.880012500  -- url: /wiki/rest/share-page/latest/share | userName: mouser | referer: https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/display/SPACE/PAGE
2013-08-28 13:11:04.880013500 java.lang.NullPointerException
2013-08-28 13:11:04.880013500 	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.sharepage.api.SharePageServiceImpl.doShare(SharePageServiceImpl.java:326)
2013-08-28 13:11:04.880022500 	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.sharepage.api.SharePageServiceImpl.access$300(SharePageServiceImpl.java:75)
2013-08-28 13:11:04.880023500 	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.sharepage.api.SharePageServiceImpl$ShareTask.runInternal(SharePageServiceImpl.java:612)
2013-08-28 13:11:04.880024500 	at com.atlassian.confluence.util.longrunning.ConfluenceAbstractLongRunningTask.run(ConfluenceAbstractLongRunningTask.java:26)
2013-08-28 13:11:04.880025500 	at com.atlassian.confluence.util.longrunning.ManagedTask.run(ManagedTask.java:35)
2013-08-28 13:11:04.880026500 	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:441)
2013-08-28 13:11:04.880027500 	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:303)
2013-08-28 13:11:04.880030500 	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:138)
2013-08-28 13:11:04.880030500 	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:886)
2013-08-28 13:11:04.880031500 	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:908)
2013-08-28 13:11:04.880031500 	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:662)
{noformat}
fields.summary: Share by Group is suggesting it was successful but it doesn't actually work

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30586].
  {panel}

Specific GIFS are not working properly in Confluence 5.1.x versions. In this case, when you try to re-size the GIF to the smallest size (thumbnail) it's not displayed in all browsers. I have attached the gif file in order to reproduce it.

h4.Steps to Reproduce

# Create a page
# Edit the Page
# Insert > Image (or Drag&Drop the GIF file)
# Re-size the image to the smallest size option:
!gifscreenshot.png!
# The image thumbnail is not displayed properly

PS: If you try to open the same GIF in a new tab, Confluence will display an 'java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException'
fields.summary: Animated GIFS can't be resized in Confluence
Page Tree should remember its state across page visits
Enabling Admin to manage Site Homepage of users and groups

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30580].
  {panel}

When adding a comment with a PDF Macro, the PDF will never render. The PDF does render normally on the same page.

*How to reproduce:*
# Create new page
# Insert PDF attachment
# Insert a PDF macro and select that PDF attachment
# Save page (PDF is correctly viewed)
# Create a comment with a PDF Macro using the same PDF.
# Save comment (view image attached)

Similar behaviour happens with PPTs: [CONF-24019|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-24019] (Created:
01/Dec/11 12:43 AM)

fields.summary: PDF Macro inside a comment won't display PDF

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30578].
  {panel}

After this week's Confluence OnDemand release, we have seen a number of instances that started up without critical plugins, such as:
* Confluence Create Content Plugin
* Confluence Software Blueprints Bundle Plugin

Confluence happily loads without giving any errors (save for some stack traces in the logs, which customers cannot see). Confluence will then have critical functionality missing, such as the "Create" button not being present.

What should happen is that Confluence should start in an 'error' state and have its pages return 500 errors so that our monitoring can detect the problem and we can do something about it, instead of relying on customer reports.
fields.summary: Confluence doesn't alert when it starts up without critical plugins

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30576].
  {panel}

As a Product Owner,
I want to see the _Summary_ of a Jira issue that has been inserted via "Insert JIRA Issue" while still in Edit mode,
So that I can organize multiple issues in my roadmap.

AC:
A. At least, ID and Summary are both shown in Edit mode.

Notes:
* Currently, only issue ID is shown.  Now would also like Summary.
* Summary is currently shown in View mode, but not Edit mode.
fields.summary: Insert JIRA Issue - Show issue Summary while in Edit mode
Tabbed Comments - Talk Tab - Wikipedia style discussion about a page
Page History/Comparison - add ability to jump to next change/diff in a page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30567].
{panel}
Allow for access to common variables for use in Blueprints templates through the template editor, eg:
 # Current date
 # Current time
 # Author
 # User
 # System baseUrl

Eg this could be used to create a Blueprint which creates pages with Title:
 2013-08-27: <user>'s Notes

 
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 27 June 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
 Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with Confluence. We agree, having common variables in Blueprints templates is something that is useful.
  
 This is something we would like to implement, but this suggestion is not on the Confluence roadmap. Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the Confluence roadmap. We will update this issue as we make further progress on it.   
{panel}
fields.summary: Allow for access to common variables in Blueprints templates

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30558].
  {panel}

How to reproduce:

    * Create a Bullet List (Click on the Bullet List button)
    * Copy two lines and paste in the bullet list session (one below the other)
    * The second line was excluded from the bullet list
    * Backspace in the second line to get the content to one bullet list
    * Enter
    * The next bullet list doesn't show up.
fields.summary: Bullet list not working properly when two lines are copied and pasted
Advanced search - provide a way to disable index of specific pages
Sharing a page with a group should respect the "notify on my actions" setting

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30547].
  {panel}

Setting the Jira macro display columns to "Priority,Key,Summary,Assignee,Description,Due" produces a display which is blank on all columns except the *key*.

Replacing with "priority,key,summary,assignee,description,due" restores the display.

This is a problem that appeared with an upgrade.  The macro worked in 3.X with capitalizations but has produced a lot of bad pages in v5.1.   Ability to enter capitals allows them to be copied from actual Jira pages where they are capitalized.  

Friendlier behaviour would be to either always allow caps or to lowercase the column list when the macro data is saved...
fields.summary: JIRA macro fails on title case column names
Ability to insert math formulas/equations in Confluence

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30541].
  {panel}

h3.Proposal
Mainly it would be a feature to enable Pages to be searched even if they restricted.

h3.Current Scenario
Pages are hidden if the user has no Permissions
fields.summary: Allow Admin to enable Pages to be shown in Search from those who have not acces to it

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30531].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to replicate
1. Create or edit a Global Template
2. Create a new "Create from template" macro
3. Try to select a Template Name

*Result:* Template Name field is not populated with any templates. This is a required field, so you are unable to create this macro on a Global Template.

h3. Workaround
1. Create a "Create from template" macro and choose settings while editing an ordinary page.
2. Copy and paste the macro into a Global Template.

*Update*: You need to select the Space Key first, which will then populate the Template Name field.
fields.summary: Cannot select template in "Create from template" macro when editing a Template
Send email to Administrators when Directory synchronization fails
Global search option - search that shows pages that the user can't view

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30528].
  {panel}

As a confluence wiki and greenhopper user, I want to be able to insert a
macro of a greenhopper board into a wiki page that would reflect changes
made in greenhopper so that i can have a view of multiple boards and make
notes and add content around that board.
fields.summary: Macro with GreenHopper Board

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30524].
  {panel}

There is a problem with comments date after editing. Comment date is changed to a date... when it was edited!
This make a really headache, when you are fixing some typo in comment from a May 2013, and now it appear in the tree like a comment from 22 Aug 2013. So, all dialogue in comments is unclear (even if you are tracking comments with some changes in SVN or other instruments).

Two variants of fixing:
* Store original comment date and just show "- edited" suffix, like it working in JIRA 4.x
* Store original comment date and show "- edited at DD mmm YYYY"  suffix

But not change an original comment date to a date of comments editing! This is really annoying!
fields.summary: Store original date of comment and add last edit date to the comments, like in JIRA
When archiving a space, make all space content read-only
Label search using Wildcards/Regex
Able to indent table
Deactivate multiple users
Unable to import Gliffy diagrams in Confluence OnDemand
Add 6th "Custom" color option to status macro
Embed Jira Issue Collector *Form in Confluence Page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30501].
  {panel}

Firefox 23 [now blocks mixed active content by default|http://blog.mozilla.org/security/2013/05/16/mixed-content-blocking-in-firefox-aurora/], so if an HTTP YouTube link is embedded using the Widget Connector in a Confluence instance that runs over HTTPS, the result is that the widget fails to appear at all. It looks like this when the page is loaded:
!ff23.png!

This improvement request is to add a placeholder image with a warning so that the user knows what is happening instead of simply seeing a blank space.

For users running into this issue, please see this KB for workarounds:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Widget+Connector+not+Displaying+Embedded+Content+when+Using+Firefox+or+Chrome
fields.summary: Show placeholder and warning in Widget Connector if embedded material is blocked by browser due to mixed active content
Update Confluence Gliffy to latest version
Add shortcut Alt+Left Arrow/Alt+Right Arrow for adding new columns while editing tables

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30487].
  {panel}

Hi,

Atlassian Confluence 5.2.3.
Browser: Chrome (latest Version).

We just upgraded our Confluence for our company. However after the upgrade it seems that the Plugin to display Jira items is not working anymore. 

SCENARIO:
- It does not show anything even though the plugin seems to be set properly (see View.png attached)
- When Editing the plugin are pulling information from Jira though (see Edit1.png attached)
- When I edit the second plugin, I confirm that there are 3 items that should be displayed on my page (see Edit2.png attached).

Could you help fixing this issue please?

I can't do much at this point. We had 2 Jira plugins in the past that were integrated it looks like you made it 1 only now. We are heavily using Jira/Wiki and that is the reason we purchased your product for the integration.

Thanks,
Fabien
fields.summary: Jira Plugin is not showing any items

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30485].
  {panel}

I am experiencing this problem in Firefox, but not in Chrome or Safari.

When I have a heading that includes a question mark, the link to that heading from the Table of Contents macro does not work.

To reproduce:

1) Create a new page.
2) Insert some Heading 1s that include a question mark at the end.
3) Insert the Table of Contents macro somewhere on the page.
4) Save your change and view the page in a Firefox browser window.

Expected result: The TOC will list all the headings (up to the level that you specified in the macro). When you click on a heading, it will take you to that section of the page.

Actual result: The TOC lists all the headings correctly, but when you click on any of them, nothing happens.

I am writing a FAQ page. It is very hard to do that without including question marks in the headings! Help!!
fields.summary: (In Firefox browser) Links in Table of Contents Macro not working when heading includes a question mark
Comments should include "creation date"

h4. Steps to reproduce:

# Insert any Youtube video link
# Save

h4. Results
The video is rendered perfectly in Chrome 28.x, but Firefox 23.x displays only a blank gap
fields.summary: Widget connector not working for Youtube in Firefox 23.x

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30462].
  {panel}

We don't tell you what the autocomplete shortcuts are for emoticons which are embedded on pages. 

If you use the dialog Insert > Emoticon we show you this:
!http://cl.ly/image/262z1H1t2i3e/Image%202013.08.20%208%3A50%3A22%20AM.png!

However once you embed it on the page, we don't give you any tooltip on viewpage of what the shortcut is. 

A suggestion is to 
1. Switch them to the AUI "chunky" tooltips style - give them more affordance. (see https://developer.atlassian.com/design/latest/tooltips.html)
2. Add the tooltips on viewpage
fields.summary: Improve emoticon discoverability in editor by adding tooltips for emoticons

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

Hey There,

I am using the latest version of Chrome and I am noticing few bugs when using the New UI of the editor. 
Powered by Atlassian Confluence 5.2.3.

# Task List added in a prefab column is removing all the the button at bottom. Save, Cancel, Preview.

It seems to be a link that was added further down my page but duplicate itself at the top of it. 
# If I edit a page and click a link it will open the page in my edited page. I have attached a screenshot because this might be the worth one.

Would be nice to have those bugs resolved. I am bit surprised this product has been released that way.

Thanks,
Fabien

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30443].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
* add jira issues macro to a page
* modify the list of columns to be 'Key;Summary'
* notice how the Summary column is not shown when the page is saved.

Dynamic mode could handle column names in a case insensitive way whereas static mode cannot. This is a critical issue because we have changed the default mode of the macro from dynamic to static. Meaning once people upgrade they might have problems if they defined custom column list with capitalised names.
fields.summary: Static mode of jira issues macro (default) cannot handle capitalised column names

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30431].
{panel}
*Steps to Reproduce:*

*Note:* I've attached a a [^IT-155110-79.xml.zip] that replicates this problem.
 # Create a 1x2 table, and insert enough text in the right column that you would expect it to run onto a second line when exported
 # Attach a large image to the page, and resize it to, for example, 900px
 # Export page to pdf

*Expected Results:*
The text should wrap. Eg:
 !Screen Shot 2013-08-16 at 4.02.00 PM.png!

*Actual Results:*
The text runs off the page:
 !Screen Shot 2013-08-16 at 4.00.23 PM.png!

*Notes:*
This *does not* occur if the image is left in its original size.

*Workaround:*
Use [sections|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Working+with+Page+Layouts+and+Columns+and+Sections] rather than tables.

Or make a change in PDF Stylesheet:
{code:java}
img
{
 -fs-fit-images-to-width: 100%  !important;
}
{code}
fields.summary: Large images in tables cause the tables to be cut off when exported to PDF

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30428].
  {panel}

h3. The problem
Inserting a URL to a saved filter, eg {{http://localhost:9604/browse/TEST-3?filter=10000}} autocompletes to the JQL content of the filter - 'description ~ "description"' in my test case - so when filter 10000 changes, the JIRA Issues  will still be 'description ~ "description"'. This is not the same as previous behaviour, where the filter would remain in the macro and changes to the filter would be reflected in Confluence.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create and view a filter in JIRA
# Copy the URL
# Create a JIRA Issues Macro in Confluence 5.2.3
# Paste the URL into the macro
#- Observe that the URL is immediately changed to the JQL of the filter.
# Save the JIRA Issues Macro
# Change the filter in JIRA so that the results are different
# Reload the Confluence page
#- Observe that the results do not reflect the changes to the filter
fields.summary: JIRA Issues Macro filter behaviour has changed so that it no longer saves the filter, but rather hard-codes the results.
All symbols show as 'Â' after saving a page.
Inherit space permissions from another space
Allow configuration of the Quartz scheduler
Dialog message experience in Safari when trying to paste images from clipboard is odd
Clean up drafts and their attachments after a configurable period of time

Space Administrators being able to add Stylesheet on their own Spaces
Support HTML5 Video in Confluence OnDemand
Please add a floating Edit menu in confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30397].
  {panel}

See: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/UPM/Problems+Connecting+to+the+Atlassian+Marketplace

In the passage:
"What's going on:

The UPM must be able connect to the Atlassian Marketplace website to perform a number of functions, such as checking for add-on updates and installing new add-ons.

If you encounter network-related problems while using UPM, try the following troubleshooting steps:

Check whether a firewall is blocking UPM access to the Atlassian servers, for example, by attempting to ping the marketplace.atlassian.com server from the computer that hosts the Atlassian application. For more information, see Configuring Marketplace Connectivity.
Universal Plugin Manger needs access to:
*.atlassian.com
https://dq1dnt4af4eyy.cloudfront.net/
By default, UPM uses the proxy settings of the host application to connect to the Marketplace. If UPM cannot connect to the Marketplace server, you should verify the proxy configuration for the host application. Refer to the documentation for the Atlassian application for instructions for configuring proxy settings, keeping in mind that you'll need to include the HTTPS configuration:"

"Universal Plugin Manger" should be "Universal Plugin Manager"
fields.summary: Typo in Confluence documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30395].
  {panel}

Looking at this documentation:

https://developer.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Remote+Confluence+Methods#RemoteConfluenceMethods-Pages
Looks like it allows to  update the actual properties of a Page, add comments and notify watchers.

However if we read this: 
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-4288?focusedCommentId=133095&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-133095

It informs Confluence does not allow to add comments or notify the users when editing pages via API. Basically the documentation is not clear.
fields.summary: Request Improvement Regarding API Documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30394].
  {panel}

Looking at this documentation: 
* https://developer.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Remote+Confluence+Methods#RemoteConfluenceMethods-Pages

Looks like this is designed to update the actual properties of a Page object, and StorePAge is to adding comments or updating a page.

However if we read this:

*    https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-4288?focusedCommentId=133095&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-133095

According to this information it tells that Confluence does not allow you to add comments or notify the users when editing pages via API. That being said, the updatePage()' method, should be used  just to comment a page(not add comments) and notify watchers.

Basically the documentation is not clear.
fields.summary: Request Improvement regarding storePage and UpdatePage API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30390].
  {panel}

I have a table that lists network devices with IP addresses. It would be useful to be able to sort by IP address so I can view devices per subnetwork.

However, it seems that Confluence fails to sort if there are no letters in that column.

Case in point: I tried adding a letter ("c" in my case) to any cell in that column and sorting worked. After removing the letter, sorting did not work.

I don't have access to this Confluence instance's logs at the moment, but I'm fairly sure Confluence runs into an exception when trying to sort this column.

To reproduce:
# Copy this into a Confluence page and try to sort by the different columns.
|| Device || IP || Location ||
| A | 192.168.0.1 | New York |
| B | 192.168.1.1 | Los Angeles |
 You should see that sorting by 'Device' or 'Location' works fine, while sorting by 'IP' does not.
# Add a letter after either IP. Now try sorting by that column again. Sorting should now work.
fields.summary: If table column only contains numeric values (such as IP addresses), sorting does not work for that column

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30388].
  {panel}

The PDF preview can't render certain PDFs and will display only blank, white pages.

The problem occurred with scanned documents which where saved with JBIG2 image compression (the default for Acrobat 5.0 and newer).

This is the resulting stack trace:
{code}
Error reading image                  
com.sun.pdfview.PDFParseException: Unknown coding method:JBIG2Decode
            at com.sun.pdfview.decode.PDFDecoder.decodeStream(PDFDecoder.java:114)
            at com.sun.pdfview.PDFObject.decodeStream(PDFObject.java:344)
            at com.sun.pdfview.PDFObject.getStream(PDFObject.java:276)
            at com.sun.pdfview.PDFObject.getStream(PDFObject.java:270)
            at com.sun.pdfview.PDFImage.getImage(PDFImage.java:224)
            at com.sun.pdfview.PDFRenderer.drawImage(PDFRenderer.java:284)
            at com.sun.pdfview.PDFImageCmd.execute(PDFPage.java:643)
            at com.sun.pdfview.PDFRenderer.iterate(PDFRenderer.java:583)
            at com.sun.pdfview.BaseWatchable.run(BaseWatchable.java:101)
            at com.benryan.conversion.PdfSlideConversionBatchTask.convertFile(PdfSlideConversionBatchTask.java:100)
            at com.benryan.conversion.PdfSlideConversionBatchTask.convertFile(PdfSlideConversionBatchTask.java:27)
            at com.benryan.conversion.AbstractSlideConversionTask.call(AbstractSlideConversionTask.java:44)
            at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:303)
            at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:138)
            at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:886)
            at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:908)
            at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:662)
java.lang.NullPointerException
            at com.sun.pdfview.font.TTFFont.getOutline(TTFFont.java:171)
            at com.sun.pdfview.font.CIDFontType2.getOutline(CIDFontType2.java:270)
            at com.sun.pdfview.font.OutlineFont.getGlyph(OutlineFont.java:130)
            at com.sun.pdfview.font.PDFFont.getCachedGlyph(PDFFont.java:308)
            at com.sun.pdfview.font.PDFFontEncoding.getGlyphFromCMap(PDFFontEncoding.java:155)
            at com.sun.pdfview.font.PDFFontEncoding.getGlyphs(PDFFontEncoding.java:115)
            at com.sun.pdfview.font.PDFFont.getGlyphs(PDFFont.java:274)
            at com.sun.pdfview.PDFTextFormat.doText(PDFTextFormat.java:269)
            at com.sun.pdfview.PDFParser.iterate(PDFParser.java:745)
            at com.sun.pdfview.BaseWatchable.run(BaseWatchable.java:101)
            at com.sun.pdfview.BaseWatchable.execute(BaseWatchable.java:263)
            at com.sun.pdfview.BaseWatchable.go(BaseWatchable.java:197)
            at com.sun.pdfview.PDFFile.getPage(PDFFile.java:1546)
            at com.benryan.conversion.PdfSlideConversionBatchTask.convertFile(PdfSlideConversionBatchTask.java:86)
            at com.benryan.conversion.PdfSlideConversionBatchTask.convertFile(PdfSlideConversionBatchTask.java:27)
            at com.benryan.conversion.AbstractSlideConversionTask.call(AbstractSlideConversionTask.java:44)
            at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:303)
            at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:138)
            at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:886)
            at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:908)
            at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:662)
{code}

Saving the file with CCITT Group 4 compression (see screenshot) will serve as workaround, i.e. the preview will be able to render the image, but the parser still outputs an (different) error:

{code}
 java.lang.NullPointerException
        at com.sun.pdfview.font.TTFFont.getOutline(TTFFont.java:171)
        at com.sun.pdfview.font.CIDFontType2.getOutline(CIDFontType2.java:270)
        at com.sun.pdfview.font.OutlineFont.getGlyph(OutlineFont.java:130)
        at com.sun.pdfview.font.PDFFont.getCachedGlyph(PDFFont.java:308)
        at com.sun.pdfview.font.PDFFontEncoding.getGlyphFromCMap(PDFFontEncoding.java:155)
        at com.sun.pdfview.font.PDFFontEncoding.getGlyphs(PDFFontEncoding.java:115)
        at com.sun.pdfview.font.PDFFont.getGlyphs(PDFFont.java:274)
        at com.sun.pdfview.PDFTextFormat.doText(PDFTextFormat.java:269)
        at com.sun.pdfview.PDFParser.iterate(PDFParser.java:745)
        at com.sun.pdfview.BaseWatchable.run(BaseWatchable.java:101)
        at com.sun.pdfview.BaseWatchable.execute(BaseWatchable.java:263)
        at com.sun.pdfview.BaseWatchable.go(BaseWatchable.java:197)
        at com.sun.pdfview.PDFFile.getPage(PDFFile.java:1546)
        at com.benryan.conversion.PdfSlideConversionBatchTask.convertFile(PdfSlideConversionBatchTask.java:86)
        at com.benryan.conversion.PdfSlideConversionBatchTask.convertFile(PdfSlideConversionBatchTask.java:27)
        at com.benryan.conversion.AbstractSlideConversionTask.call(AbstractSlideConversionTask.java:44)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:303)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:138)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:886)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:908)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:662)
{code}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-30374].
  {panel}

To recreate:
1) Create a blank page
2) Select bullet list from toolbar and type something
3) Press enter for new line
4) Backspace to clear bullet and now add "expand" macro
5) Within "expand macro," select numbered list from toolbar

Note that instead of creating a new numbered list within the expand macro, it changes the bullet list before the expand section.

This can be worked around by adding a couple carriage returns to break out of the list element and then re-indenting the "expand" macro, however this has caused some frustration with users.
fields.summary: Expand macro, when created after list, does not allow creating a list within expand section
JIRA issues macro shouldn't change from XML to JQL
Freeze rows in Confluence table
Edit 'Configuring Attachment Size' documentation
Documentation link for the Insert ‘Tasklist’ Macro goes to deprecated page.
